Title: pg_input_error_info
Feature: pg_input_error_info ( string text, type text ) → record ( message text, detail text, hint text, sql_error_code text )
Description: Tests whether the given string is valid input for the specified data type; if not, return the details of the error that would have been thrown. If the input is valid, the results are NULL. The inputs are the same as for pg_input_is_valid.

This function will only work as desired if the data type's input function has been updated to report invalid input as a “soft” error. Otherwise, invalid input will abort the transaction, just as if the string had been cast to the type directly.
